div.p: RELATION between sentences S1 and S2 such that it is NOT TRUE that S1 AND NOT S2.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／
誠 "if really, if 'to the full'" is an emphatic conditional particle suggesting the problematic nature of the fulfilment of the condition.

bibl.title: Vocabulaire européen des philosophies. Dictionnaire des intraduisibles
Encyclopedia of Language and Linguistics. Second Edition

sense.def: if only, as long as, when
苟子之不欲 "if you really do not want to" "nominalised" marked conditional subordinate clause
不聽其言也“In case he does not accept the proposal": in case that; if ever S; even if ever
君子之仕也“If the gentleman serves in office" marker of a subordinate conditial clause, the protasis
now if at this point S1, then S2
if you just, as long as you
supposing as a purely hypothetical and theoretical, or at least remote, possibility
if someone 其言之不怍， "If in making public commitments one is not shy..."
if (with non-referential subject or indefinite subject)
only if (subordinated clause comes after the main clause)
supposing that it is so; if

bibl.title: 唐五代語言詞典 Táng Wǔdài yǔyán cídiǎn A Dictionary of the Language of the Tang and Five Dynasties Periods

sense.def: if ever 所不與舅氏同心者， "Uncle, if from now on I fail to be of one heart with you..."
人之所忌 "When men are full of fear..."
if ever 予所否者 "If I have have done something wrong..."
if ZGC: 秦為知之，必不救也。
e.g. 如此者 "if one acts like that": if; in all cases when
if ( as in English "if you are hungry there is something in the fridge")
e.g. 人臣而仁 "if a minister is kind-hearted": if
question particle functioning as a marker of what is in effect a subordinate sentence
if; or if (often with implicit subject and without 則 in main clause, and note 若...是 as in 若晉常先，是楚弱也 which has many parallels. Apodosis often )
if (as in If you are hungry there are some eggs in the fridge)
if really; as long as really; as long as truly
THERE IS A MESS-UP WITH THE GRAPHS, READ gǒu: if
to suppose hypothetically, let us suppose hypothetically(sometimes correlating with 亦 in S2)
if by any chance???? (or: if anyone by any chance)
if by any chance; if on the other hand GY: 若其予之 若其有知 "if they have awareness"
If it were really to happen that...
if HS: 自京師不曉，況於遠方 "If this is not known n the capital, how much less in distant parts"
if by any chance, suppose by chance
必...乃 if it it needed that S1 then S2
perfective modal particle marking the conditional clause
